page.title: 10BRIDGES IN OUR AREA
page.content: We have six bridges in our area.These are Thorngate Footbridge which runs over the River Tees,Abbey {Bridge}which runs over the River Tees near Egglestone Abbey,Bow Bridge which is an old pack horse bridge and a later bridge for traffic is beside it. There are also two Thorsgill Bridges, one old and one new,higher up the beck. Thorngate Footbridge 048,159 is partly a cantilever and partly an arched bridge.It is constructed of steel girders and a wooden walkway.It is 71 metres long and 2 metres wide.The colour of it is green.It bridges the River Tees,joining Barnard Castle with the village of Startforth.The Cleveland Bridge Company built this unique bridge in 1882.
